DOC.brief_summary: Hypothesis: Does a 50% reduction in radiation in dose significantly affect the diagnostic quality of chest CT
DOC.detailed_description: Patients with Lymphoma are recruited and have a follow up CT performed at 50% of the standard exposure parameters. The studies are compared for image quality with a recent (<3 months) thoracic CT performed at standard exposure parameters.
DOC.criteria: Patients with Lymphoma No recent (<3 months) thoracic CT
